listContent: Be enrolled in a New York City high school
Have earned at 17 credits or more

openHouseHeading.mainHeading: OPEN HOUSES ARE AVAILABLE ALL YEAR

attendButtonLabel.mainHeading: CONTACT US TO ATTEND AN OPEN HOUSE

admissionsButtonLabel.mainHeading: LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR ADMISSIONS PROCESS

fitHeading.mainHeading: ARE WE A FIT FOR YOU?

registrationPara.content: All students that register must come in person with a parent or guardian to complete their registration and orientation.

orientationPara.content: Students are required to come in with a parent or guardian for registration for a mandatory orientation and then register.

registrationLocationPara.content: Registration is ongoing. We will be in the Library on the first floor at Washington Irving Campus 40 Irving Place, New York, NY 10003.

inPersonRegistrationPara.content: Even though registration is in person, you can log in to meet with Guidance Counselors, CBO and Site Directors to have your questions answered.

studentPara.content: Students attend Washington Irving YABC program part-time to earn a high school diploma. Students graduate with a diploma from their home day school after they have earned all their credits and passed all their required exams or satisfied their portfolio requirements.

servePara.content: We care and want to serve ALL learners. We specialize in helping students with IEPs, 504s, and English For New Language learners.

supportPara.content: Washington Irving YABC is supported by the Learning to Work program. Mission Society of NYC manages our program and provides PAID internships for students who need to support themselves while attending school. Additionally, Mission Society of NYC provides student support services, in-depth job readiness, and college and career readiness activities. Please note that we are considerate of the work schedules of students who have secured their own jobs.
